newsitem.title: USA: Cyclone continues to strengthen in S.W.Pacific-WSC.
newsitem.headline: Cyclone continues to strengthen in S.W.Pacific-WSC.

text.p: Tropical cyclone Gavin continues to strengthen in the southwest Pacific and is rapidly becoming very dangerous, independent forecaster Weather Services Corp said on Thursday.
The storm, west of the southern Tuvalu islands, is expected to track towards the Fiji islands, it said.
Top winds are 130 mph and may reach 140-145 mph in 24 hours as the storm heads southward.
This system will be an extreme risk to shipping and boating in the region over the next 24-48 hours and Fiji will be at risk of wind and flood damage in about 36 hours.
